p: Cyphostemma juttae (Dinter & Gilg) Desc. (Vitaceae) is a tree-like succulent plant up to 2 meters tall that forms a massive caudex with thick branches. Stems and branches are covered in yellow and papery skin, peeling off with age. Leaves are deciduous, succulent, up to 20 cm long and 6 cm wide, and are produced in Summer during the vegetative season. This species grows in Namibia, it is adapted to very dry environments and it is also cultivated as ornamental in specialized collections.
